: Army teams on Sunday recovered the body of a soldier who had gone missing following an avalanche in the Kargil area of Jammu and Kashmir.

“On the third day of a gruelling search operation, the teams managed to recover the mortal remains of sepoy Vijay Kumar K from under 12 feet of snow,” a Defence spokesman said here.

He said the search continued for three days despite adverse weather conditions and up to 15 feet of snow. Rescue dogs, deep penetration radars and metal detectors were used.

“Vijay, who belongs to Vallaramapuram village of Tirunelvelli district of Tamil Nadu, is survived by his parents and two younger sisters,” the spokesman said.

Sepoy Sujit, the soldier rescued on the first day itself, is recovering well, he said. — PTI
title: Kargil avalanche: body of sepoy retrieved
